task.summary: Default task
Custom Fonts Better Textured Backgrounds Indicators (Now in a working version!)

Inventory Panel Implemented to cover Default Party List.
Can be disabled via /glam config
Changing font or font size on the inventory panel will reload the entire addon. This is done as a temporary measure to avoid crashing the addons plugin while I search for a fix for the crash.
Fix for Crash on Zoning issue
Fixed Gil Crash on Zone and improper login screen issues.

Bug Fix: Pet not lined up properly with rest of party. Target Arrow not rendering on Pet.
Preparations for buff/debuff icons on party list. Not functional yet, but files and functions are starting to be added.

Bug Fix: Pet not lined up properly with rest of party. Target Arrow not rendering on Pet.
Preparations for buff/debuff icons on party list. Not functional yet, but files and functions are starting to be added.
Hiding of UI elements when opening /rmap, /cmap, /bmap, or /map.
Target Name reflecting claim, NPC, Mob, Anon, etc..
Reworked Fill Texture Adjustment for cleaner appearance.
Reworked Fill Texture Adjustment for cleaner appearance.
Reworked Fill Texture Adjustment for cleaner appearance.

Complete Rewrite from the Ground Up. Official Release of Version 1.0 Performance increases across the board. New Features: Party Member Buff Icons in Party list. Redesign of Alliance Panel Rework of Treasure Pool Lot Rendering for Alliance Panel Default In-Game Party list toggle (Hides rendering of default party list.) Completely redesigned Configuration GUI. Control of all settings moved to Configuration GUI. Element dimensions for party list moved into the Layout Files. Loading a different layout will change dimensions of elements. Party Invite Notification (Use /join or /decline to clear this notification for now.)
Fixed crash when toggling theming engine for Player Stats
Fixed crash when toggling theming engine for Player Stats
Fixed crash when toggling theming engine for Player Stats
Crash Fix on Teleport/Escape casts
Crash Fix on Teleport/Escape casts

Small Bug Fix causing invisible names
Delete your settings file to resolve:
config\addons\GlamourUI\[CHARACTERNAME]\settings.lua
Replaced Missing Texture in some themes.
Party Member Distance Indicator EXP Bar EXP/Hr EXP/Hr Reset (Click the EXP/HR reading) Merit Points LP/Hr and Reset
Fixed Issue with Party Distance
Fixed Issue with Party Distance
Removed BG Texture and enabled imgui Backgrounds for windows.
Crash Fix: Oversight with new features
Crash Fix: Oversight with new features
Crash Fix: Oversight with new features
Disabled Treasure Pool Functionality while it's being rewritten.
Crash Fix from broken treasure pool
Crash Fix from broken treasure pool
Crash Fix from broken treasure pool
Crash Fix from broken treasure pool
Crash Fix from broken treasure pool

New Features: Environment Panel Time, Day, and Weather provided in a moveable panel.
Focus Target Panel New Focus Target System and panel have been added. Entries can be added with the new command /glam focus add Entries can be removed individually with the button next to the entry's HP bar List can be cleared entirely with the new command /glam focus clear
To Do: Config options for Environment Panel Config options for Focus Target Panel Click-To-Target for Focus Target Panel

New Features: Environment Panel Time, Day, and Weather provided in a moveable panel.
Focus Target Panel New Focus Target System and panel have been added. Entries can be added with the new command /glam focus add Entries can be removed individually with the button next to the entry's HP bar List can be cleared entirely with the new command /glam focus clear
To Do: Config options for Environment Panel Config options for Focus Target Panel Click-To-Target for Focus Target Panel
Small Bugfix
Crash Fix on Zone Exception handling for no target on /glam focus add
Crash Fix on Zone Exception handling for no target on /glam focus add
Implemented JP and CP into Player Stats Panel
Implemented JP and CP into Player Stats Panel

Mild Bug Fixes
New Feature: Treasure Pool When the treasure pool is open, a treasure pool panel will appear with information about items in the pool. This panel also provides buttons to pass or lot on items in the pool.
Formatting fixes in Treasure Pool Panel for readability.
Fixed commands not working
Fixed commands not working
Fixed commands not working

Fixed Target Window Name Color Inconsistency
Added mob level to target window when targeting a combat target mob. --- This level requires receiving a widescan packet for the mob in question. Without data on the mob in question, the level will read as ???.

Added Exemplar Points and Master Levels into the Player Stats Panel.
*KNOWN ISSUE* Due to how FFXI updates the player information in-game, the exp bar, current exp value, the merit, JP, and ML equivalents, and the current JP totals may be outdated. This is due to the fact that FFXI does not update these values until zoning, logging in, or opening the status menu. If the values lag behind, opening the status menu will update them.

New setting: Checkbox: "Fill Down"
This setting determines the order in which the party list populates.
***This WILL require one of 2 prep steps if upgrading from a previous version of GlamourUI:
You must either delete your existing settings file, or add the following into your settings file:
settings["Party"]["pList"]["FillDown"] = true|false; -- use true or false
OR
Delete your settings.lua file in config\addons\GlamourUI\CharName_ID\settings.lua

Lots of new updates, most of which are bug-fixes.
Added Job Icons
Small BugFix to 1.8.0

MESSAGE.value: Reworked Fill Texture Adjustment for cleaner appearance.

Complete Rewrite from the Ground Up. Official Release of Version 1.0 Performance increases across the board. New Features: Party Member Buff Icons in Party list. Redesign of Alliance Panel Rework of Treasure Pool Lot Rendering for Alliance Panel Default In-Game Party list toggle (Hides rendering of default party list.) Completely redesigned Configuration GUI. Control of all settings moved to Configuration GUI. Element dimensions for party list moved into the Layout Files. Loading a different layout will change dimensions of elements. Party Invite Notification (Use /join or /decline to clear this notification for now.)
Fixed crash when toggling theming engine for Player Stats
Crash Fix on Teleport/Escape casts
Small Bug Fix causing invisible names

Fixed Target Window Name Color Inconsistency
Added mob level to target window when targeting a combat target mob. --- This level requires receiving a widescan packet for the mob in question. Without data on the mob in question, the level will read as ???.

Added Exemplar Points and Master Levels into the Player Stats Panel.
*KNOWN ISSUE* Due to how FFXI updates the player information in-game, the exp bar, current exp value, the merit, JP, and ML equivalents, and the current JP totals may be outdated. This is due to the fact that FFXI does not update these values until zoning, logging in, or opening the status menu. If the values lag behind, opening the status menu will update them.

New setting: Checkbox: "Fill Down"
This setting determines the order in which the party list populates.
***This WILL require one of 2 prep steps if upgrading from a previous version of GlamourUI:
You must either delete your existing settings file, or add the following into your settings file:
settings["Party"]["pList"]["FillDown"] = true|false; -- use true or false
OR
Delete your settings.lua file in config\addons\GlamourUI\CharName_ID\settings.lua
